pageContent:
Shrawani Nepalli ◊ Shrawani.nepalli@gmail.com ◊ 203-444-0135
Austin, Tx
BUSINESS ANALYST / SCRUM MASTER
BUSINESS ANALYSIS  SCRUM MASTER AGILE MANAGEMENT  
Excellent,  proven,  hands-on  senior  Business  Analyst  and  Scrum  Master  with  excellent  communication  and 
Analysis  skills  with  10  years  of  combined  experience  in  Public  Sector,  Mutual  Insurance,  Banking,  Retirement, 
Retail  &  Finance.  Expert  at  managing  data,  time,  quality  and  people.  Expert  at  matching  content  to  audience. 
Details-driven, results-focused, adept at working with every stratum of User from Dev to Executives.
Professional and Core Competencies Summary
10  Years  of  experience  as  a  Business  Analyst  with  immense  knowledge  and  experience  in  SDLC. 
Repeatedly delivered success, quality processes to accomplish the project goals. Always served as liaison 
between the business and the development team.

Repeatedly delivered success, quality processes to accomplish the project goals. Always served as liaison 
between the business and the development team.
HHSC-  CMBHS  Project  Delivery  Expert-  Delivered  functional,  technical,  reporting  requirements,  UAT 
test cases and Claims/billing requirements for HCBS-AMH program.
Experience in Gathering Requirements: By conducting Project kick off session, JAD sessions, one-on-
one interviews, brainstorming and white board sessions, requirement reviews, storyboarding, shadowing 
and system walkthroughs.
Experience  in  performing  Data  Analysis:  By  performing  Gap  Analysis  between  “AS  Is”  and  “To  Be” 
process  flows,  systems  or  applications.  Strong  experience  in  analyzing  the  raw  data  and  creating  the 
mapping documents for the development team to code and test.
Experience  in  Documentation:  By  creating  Business  Requirement  documentation  (BRD),  Functional

mapping documents for the development team to code and test.
Experience  in  Documentation:  By  creating  Business  Requirement  documentation  (BRD),  Functional 
Requirement  Documentation  (FRD),  Technical  specification  documents  for  reporting,  Reporting 
Mock  ups,  User  stories,  Wire  frames,  Use  Cases,  Use  Case  Diagrams,  State  Diagrams,  Activity 
Diagrams, Sequence Diagrams. Process flow Diagrams, Functional Requirements Specifications (FRS), 
System Requirements Specifications (SRS), Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM), RACI Charts, Users 
Guides, Training materials, Help desk references, cheat sheets, data mapping, Scope of Work (SOW) and 
Local Mental Health Authority (LMHA) Reference Documentation.
Experience in Agile framework and Scum Principles: Scrum Methodology/Agile Ceremonies (Backlog 
grooming,  Sprint  planning,  Sprint  Review,  Retrospectives,  Daily  stand-ups),  Distributed  Agile

grooming,  Sprint  planning,  Sprint  Review,  Retrospectives,  Daily  stand-ups),  Distributed  Agile 
Project execution / SAFe agile practices, Iteration/Sprint planning meetings, Agile estimation (Planning 
poker), Kanban for support teams, Story prioritization technique (MoSCoW).
Extensive   experience   in   Healthcare:   CMBHS   application,   Care   management,   Care   coordination, 
utilization management, claims processing, Member enrollment (Medicare/Medicaid), Provider network 
management,   Medicare,   Medicaid,   Medicare   Enrollment   system   (Health   Edge/Health   Rules   Payor 
application), Claims adjudication (RAPS and Encounters), EDI X12 transactions (834, 837, 835, 270/271, 
276/277) and knowledge of industry compliance standards like HIPAA regulations.
Proficient skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, SharePoint and Visio).
Proven ability to work both as a part of the team and independently to achieve project quality goals.

Proficient skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, SharePoint and Visio).
Proven ability to work both as a part of the team and independently to achieve project quality goals.
Skilled  at  solving  challenges  in  a  directed,  methodological  manner  and  analyzes  the  current  issue  to 
envision creative solutions.
Always  took  initiative  to  develop  a  collaborative  approach  among  teams  before,  during  and  after  the 
requirement gathering sessions to achieve a common mission, vision, value and goals.
Certificate and Skill sets
Certified Scrum Master – April/2018
Methodologies- Safe Agile, Scrum and Waterfall.
UML Diagrams- Use Case diagram, Sequence diagram, Activity diagram, process flows.
Requirement Management Tools- TFS, Devops, Jira, Rally, HP Quality Center.
Database- MS-Access, Oracle 10g/12c, SQL Server 2012.
Microsoft tools- Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Visio and Share Point

Shrawani Nepalli ◊ Shrawani.nepalli@gmail.com ◊ 203-444-0135
Austin, Tx
Reporting Tools- Business Objects, Tableau and MicroStrategy.
HealthCare   Applications-   CMBHS,   Health   Rules/Health   Edge,   Voyager,   Encounter   Manager,   Care 
Manager CFG 6.4.3.5.
EXPERIENCES AND ACHIEVEMENTS
Client: Texas Health and Human Services (HHSC)- AUSTIN, TX (March.2019 – Present)
Project Name: Automation of Home and Community Based Service- Adult Mental Health (HCBS-AMH)
Job Location: Austin, TX
Role: Sr. Business Analyst 
Project Description: Home and Community Based Services-Adult Mental Health is a statewide program that 
provides mental health and substance use recovery services for eligible adults with serious mental illness. The 
services are provided at the person’s home or where they live. 
This project will help the users automate their manual process through application called Clinical Management

services are provided at the person’s home or where they live. 
This project will help the users automate their manual process through application called Clinical Management 
for Behavioral Health Services (CMBHS). Scope of this project is to implement all the new required features and 
enhance the existing features for this program into the CMBHS application and provide training on how to use 
the application with existing and new added features. The CMBHS application will be used by all the Local 
Mental Health Agencies (LMHA’s), State Hospital staffs, Provider Agencies and Recovery Management Entities 
from Provider set up, creating client profile, Assessments, Enrollment, Services and submitting claims to TMHP.
Key Responsibilities:
Facilitated various requirement elicitation sessions, follow up sessions with business SME’s & 
business users to gather functional and technical requirements.
Facilitated and been a part of project kick off session, brain storming session, grooming

business users to gather functional and technical requirements.
Facilitated and been a part of project kick off session, brain storming session, grooming 
sessions and weekly status meetings.
Always acted as a liaison between the business team and the development. 
Captured and documented all the meeting minutes of all the project related sessions and shared 
them with the business users and cross functional team SharePoint.
Created various artifacts like process flows, wireframes, use case diagrams through Visio and 
presented them during the requirement and elicitation sessions.
Documented all new feature requirements/implementation for HCBS-AMH program in Agile 
requirement document, created user stories in TFS and updated the use case documents for the 
existing features.
Worked on the Home and Community Based Services – Adult Mental Health program requirements 
from Enrollment Module to Submission of Claims.

existing features.
Worked on the Home and Community Based Services – Adult Mental Health program requirements 
from Enrollment Module to Submission of Claims. 
Performed Data analysis on the mapping document to submit 278 & 837 files to TMHP and receive 
835 files from TMHP. 
Worked on the Medicaid Eligibility Verification and TIERs module to capture requirements for 
Client’s enrollment.
Also worked on the General Revenue claims for Adult Mental Health program.
Captured reporting requirements for Provider set up, Staff, client profile, Enrollment etc. 
Performed data analysis, created mock up using excel and user stories for the developer to 
build reports.
Have created documents with all the project details for cross functional team to develop the features 
as per business needs.

Shrawani Nepalli ◊ Shrawani.nepalli@gmail.com ◊ 203-444-0135
Austin, Tx
To ensure that there are no road blocks or hurdles to achieve the project goal/scope, always took 
initiative in communicating and clarifying the requirements between the business and development 
team.
Always been a good team player, provided knowledge transfers and trainings to the new hires 
and the team on project scope and the CMBHS application.
Client: First Care Health Plans (June.2018 – February.2019)
Project Name: Special Needs Plan Implementation for Medicare.
Job Location: Austin, TX
Role: Business Analyst/Scrum Master
Project Description: This project is to implement Special Needs Plan of those who are eligible for both 
Medicare & Medicaid. In Continuing First Care’s effort to provide high quality, affordable healthcare to the 
community, First Care has re-entered the Medicare advantage Market by implementing the SPN (Special Needs

community, First Care has re-entered the Medicare advantage Market by implementing the SPN (Special Needs 
Plan) HealthCare benefit plan. This product will provide dual coverage to members with specific diseases or 
characteristics.
Worked on various phases of the project beginning from the Enrollment process to sending out correspondence 
to the members.
Key Responsibilities:
Followed waterfall Methodology in gathering requirements from the business users.
Acted as a liaison between the Business users and the development team.
Facilitated various project Kick off meetings, requirements gathering and elicitation sessions, weekly status 
calls with the Vendors, Executive committee meetings, brain storming sessions with various internal users 
and with the external vendors.
Created various artifacts to capture and document business requirements likes BRD, UAT documents for 
UAT testing, RACI Charts, process flow diagrams.

and with the external vendors.
Created various artifacts to capture and document business requirements likes BRD, UAT documents for 
UAT testing, RACI Charts, process flow diagrams.
Very good knowledge and experience working on Health Rules Payor application which was used for 
Enrollment, claims process and used for Encounter Management to submit claims to CMS.
Hands on experience working on Health Rules Care Manger application tool version CFG 6.4.3.5 to 
build Case Management Correspondence for different like of business like CHIP, Medicaid, Medicare 
& Commercial.
Good knowledge on how to work with the Encounters and RAPS files.
Client: Cuna Mutual (April.2017 – March.2018)
Project Name: Project Diamond
Job Location: Madison, WI
Role: Business Report Analyst/Scrum Master
Project Description: Cuna Mutual is a financial company providing services for the Credit Union leaders who

Job Location: Madison, WI
Role: Business Report Analyst/Scrum Master
Project Description: Cuna Mutual is a financial company providing services for the Credit Union leaders who 
were looking for an insurance and investment partners. More than 80 years by Credit Union. Cuna Mutual 
worked with 95 percent of Credit Unions in the United States – protecting their business and their members.
Project Diamond is a part of the retirement sector of Cuna Mutual, where the scope of the project is to build 
reports and application for the users on insurance plans, investments (Mutual Funds) and the different 
types of fees allocated to Loans.
Key Responsibilities: 
Used  Agile/Safe  or  Lean  methodology  for  gathering  business  requirements,  writing  User  Stories  and 
acceptance criteria’s.

team.

Client: Visa Inc. (March 2016 – February. 2017)
Project Name: Visa Data Manager
Job Location: Austin, TX
Role: Business Analyst/Scrum Master
Project Description: Visa Inc. is an American Multinational financial service in the United States. It facilitates 
electronic fund transfers throughout the world, most commonly through Visa branded credit and debit cards. 
Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers; rather, Visa provides financial 
institutions with Visa-branded payment products that they then use to offer credit, debit, prepaid and cash-
access programs to their customers.
VDM (Visa data Manager) is an External Facing, US centric, Data Warehousing and Analytics application targeted 
towards reporting Visa Net data for Issuers, Acquirers, Merchants, cardholder activity and Fraud. 
 Key Responsibilities:

towards reporting Visa Net data for Issuers, Acquirers, Merchants, cardholder activity and Fraud. 
 Key Responsibilities: 
Used Agile/Scrum method for gathering business requirements and writing User Stories.
Facilitated interviews and JAD sessions with SMEs to discuss on the requirements.
Analyzed  and  prioritized  the  business  requirements  in  close  collaboration  with  business  and  development 
team.
Worked closely with the product owner and development team to prepare the product backlog to capture the 
features, prioritize and document the estimates and milestones for a release.
Involved in story point discussions with development teams to analyze the level of effort involved to complete 
the story.
Involved in a variety of scrum ceremonies like daily Scrum, Sprint Demos, Sprint planning, Sprint Review, 
and Backlog Grooming sessions all towards trying to have effective communication and avoid roadblocks.

and Backlog Grooming sessions all towards trying to have effective communication and avoid roadblocks.

Used  MS  Visio  to  prepare  UML  diagrams  (like  Activity  Diagrams,  Sequence  Diagrams  and  Workflows), 
mocking up UI designs, wireframes etc.

Austin, Tx

Used Jira to write user stories, check the sprint/task status, assign tasks and track defects.
Client: Quest Diagnostics (January 2014 - February 2016)
Project Name: Quest Claims
Job Location: Columbus, OH
Role: Business Analyst
Project Description: Quest Diagnostics is the leading Lab Information System in the United States of America 
serving more than a million clients. 
The scope of the project was to implement an application that allowed patients to review plan information and

serving more than a million clients. 
The scope of the project was to implement an application that allowed patients to review plan information and 
find  in  network  providers,  for  patients,  providers  and  clearing  houses  to  review  submitted  X12  835  claim 
statuses, expansion of network providers globally and handling of international insurance claims in compliance 
with HIPAA standards.
Key Responsibilities:
Involved in gathering the requirements that were critical to the business process flow and using those 
requirements for the Business Requirements Document (BRD), for the implementation of the NPI in EDI 
X12 transactions as mandated by the Federal Regulation.
Conducted JAD sessions with Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) to obtain domain level information, 
interviewing and asking detailed questions and carefully recording the requirements in a format that can be 
reviewed an understood by both business and technical team.

interviewing and asking detailed questions and carefully recording the requirements in a format that can be

Compliance Standards for Membership Enrollment.
Extensively worked with Member/Subscriber and HIPAA Privacy Facets application groups on claims.
Involved in HIPPA and HL7 assessment and HIPAA X12 EDI transaction (834,835, 837, 270, 271, 276, and 
277) mapping and identified changes that need to complete to comply with HIPAA regulations.
Worked with user to define user acceptance test cases. Involved in UAT testing (User Acceptance Testing) 
and procured signoff from the involved parties.
Conducted Data analysis using SQL on the backend databases for producing mapping documentation and 
transformation rules for developers.

Client: Macy’s (May 2012 – December. 2013)
ProjectName: Member Activity Reporting System (MARS)
Job Location: Atlanta, GA
Role: Business Analyst
Project Description: Macy’s, Inc. is one of the nation’s premier retailers. Macy's, Inc. engages in the operation 
of stores, websites, and mobile applications. It operates its business under the brand names Macy's, 
Bloomingdale's, and Blue mercury, which sells merchandise, including apparel and accessories, cosmetics, home 
furnishings, and other consumer goods.

Bloomingdale's, and Blue mercury, which sells merchandise, including apparel and accessories, cosmetics, home 
furnishings, and other consumer goods.
The  project  is  about  an  E-gifting  application  that  is  embedded  on  every  product  page  on  macy.com.  This 
application allows customers to give a thoughtful and tangible gift online.

Shrawani Nepalli ◊ Shrawani.nepalli@gmail.com ◊ 203-444-0135

Project Name: Portfolio Management System (PMS)
Job Location: Newark, NJ

Client: Merrill Lynch (September.2010 – April.2012) 
Project Name: Portfolio Management System (PMS)
Job Location: Newark, NJ
Role: Business Analyst
Project Description: Merrill Lynch wealth management is the division of Bank of America. 
Portfolio  Management  System  (PMS)  developed  specifically  to  support  Merrill  Lynch’s  subsidiary  to  provide 
valuable  advisory  services  to  clients.  The  objective  of  the  project  was  to  create  a  user-friendly  application  for 
financial  advisors  that  can  manage  client’s  wealth  through  setting  goals,  objectives  and  risk  tolerance  and 
Integrating of the systems through SOA (Service Oriented Architecture) with multiple financial systems such as 
applications   used   in   regular   banking,   stock   exchange   and   regulatory   process,   investing   on   Mutual 
Funds/Life Insurance.

applications   used   in   regular   banking,   stock   exchange   and   regulatory   process,   investing   on   Mutual 
Funds/Life Insurance.

timelines are taken care.
